body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette, Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky:

The undersigned Jurymen who sat upon the case of the Commonwealth vs. William Bradford, convicted of "Grand Larceny" and sentenced to one years inprisonment, at the present term of the Jefferson Circuit Court, Members of the bar and others who heard the testimony in said cause humbly petition your Excellency to exercise your pardoning power in behalf of said Bradford. Respectfully representing, to your Excellency that they understand that the unfortunate prisoner has a family in Missouri dependent upon his exertions for their support that he has suffered nearly six months confinement in the county Jail- and that by the calculation of the jury the articles said to be stolen only exceeded, the ^in^ gold value, of four dollars by the sum of seventeen cents by praying you to grant to said Bradford a pardon for this offense.

Go McKiney
S M Groves
R. H. Sheppard
W. H Furgurson
William P. H. Watkins Jr
H. A Durnny
J. G. White
P A N Bradly
H Strauss
F B Green
John Price - Foreman
